H0.text: To digest food is the primary function of the excretory system.

H1.text: To help in defense is the primary function of the excretory system, which, along with the other body systems composed of specialized cells, tissues, and organs, performs specific roles that aid in the survival of the human species.

H2.text: To eliminate waste is the primary function of the excretory system, a specialized system of cells, tissues, and organs that helps the human body survive.

H3.text: To enable movement is the primary function of the excretory system, one of the systems composed of specialized cells, tissues, and organs in the human body, each of which has a specific function that aids in the survival of the human species.

A4.text: The excretory system is a passive biological system that removes excess, unnecessary materials from the body fluids of an organism, so as to help maintain internal chemical homeostasis and prevent damage to the body.

A5.text: The large intestine's main function is to transport food particles through the body and expel the indigestible parts at the other end, but it also collects waste from throughout the body.
